creator: sfhowes

content:
Michele Thompson said
Good Morning! I hope this message finds you well. I have been using the Mozilla family of products for a long time. One feature that I do miss is the ability to make my emails special by adding backgrounds into them. If this feature is still available please advise on how to get this done because I can not find a way to do this. If this feature isn't still available please bring it back. I miss it greatly especially during the holidays. It gives the holiday emails a little bit extra. Thank you for your time! Michele Thompson (user since approximately 2005)

In the Write window, click in the message body, select Format/Page Colours and Background... Choose File... to browse to the image (see picture). Press Alt if the Menu Bar with Format is hidden.
creator: sfhowes

content: Using Fedora 42 with Firewalld enabled and NordVpn.

content: Thunderbird non ha limiti al numero di destinatari. Quale errore ricevi di preciso se invii a più di 1000 destinatari?
creator: @next

content:
L'errore esatto è: "Invio del messaggio non riuscito. Si è verificatpo un errore durante l'invio della posta. il server di posta ha risposto: Error: too many recipients"

Leggendo l'errore io ho pensato che la colpa è del forntiore del servizio smtp ma lui dice di no.
creator: rov75

content: Il messaggio è chiaro, è il server che ti blocca. Può darsi abbiano limiti differenti a seconda che usi la loro interfaccia web o un client di terze parti come Thunderbird. Ripeto però Thunderbird ti sta solo mostrando il messaggio che ha ricevuto come risposta dal server.
creator: @next

content: bars with options are set at view>toolbars if not shown, click alt key and then click view>toolbars and set. repeat this process also after clicking 'new message' as the options are different there.

content:
BenjaminHopkinson said
I'm lost and need advice from Thunderbird direct. How do I get it?

You need to listen to the good advice you are given. No one is paid to help users of Thunderbird, so work with the folk that are freely giving of their time, because they are all you are going to get. Placing what amounts to a duplicate topic some 10 minutes after your last post here is not going to be effective in generating the result you apparently think it will. I will be closing your other topic as a duplicate of this one. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1536696#question-reply

david said
bars with options are set at view>toolbars if not shown, click alt key and then click view>toolbars and set. repeat this process also after clicking 'new message' as the options are different there.

Which looks like this

Did you do that in the compose window after you clicked new message like David asked you or not?

BenjaminHopkinson said
Thank you Michael. That has worked well for the inbox page. But for New Message, I press Alt and the bars come up but insert and format are not available, nor is send. Then when I start to write it all disappears again. Where is set.?

Do you mean like this

Place the insertion point in the text area of the email and if you are composing in HTML they will change like this.

content:
AE Artelettrica Snc said
Good morning, I am having trouble creating additional email accounts: once I enter my name and full email address, the automatic configuration starts but remains in search mode indefinitely without completing. Thank you in advance.

If you have the account hub enabled in Settings/General, disable it and add the account from ⇶ - New Account - Email.

content:
TB 115 supports 10.12 and higher, 128 supports 10.15 and higher. TB 115 is available here:

https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/115.18.0/mac/
creator: sfhowes

content:
Yes, I have ESR 115.18, but I was wondering if T-bird ESR updates were being released as is being done on this schedule https://whattrainisitnow.com/release/?version=esr

I've also added a screenshot of the particular section.
creator: romad

content:
The picture shows the schedule for Firefox. There is no version of TB above 115 that supports OS X 10.13.

https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/releases/
creator: sfhowes

content:
I was using Firefox ESR's new schedule as an example. Firefox ESR updates had originally ended but Mozilla decided to add at least 6 more months of updates Firefox ESR 115.28 through 115.33. The question is if something similar either HAD happened or WAS going to happen with T-bird ESR 115.18.

Apparently you are as in the dark as I am about the possibility. Hopefully someone more knowledgeable than both of us might chime in here.
creator: romad

content: your post is vague. Here are some thoughts: gmail and outlook automatically save to sent folder. if you have thunderbird set to do that, I suggest UNticking it to eliminate saving twice. that may resolve your issue.
creator: davidsk

content: If you don't need to access sent messages on other devices, you could set the target for sent mail to Local Folders (if sent messages aren't automatically saved). To save space, define a filter as in the attached picture and run it manually on the folder with sent messages.
creator: sfhowes
